content:
I'm more likely to reflect on my own life and habits when I'm reading self-help and personal development books. These books really make me think about my values, goals, and priorities, and they encourage me to examine my habits and behaviors more closely. I find that reading these books helps me to identify areas where I can improve and make positive changes in my life.

One of the insights that has really resonated with me from "Daring Greatly" is the idea that we need to be willing to take risks and be vulnerable in order to truly live wholeheartedly. It's easy to get caught up in trying to present a perfect image on social media, but Brené Brown's work has helped me to see that it's okay to be imperfect and that vulnerability is actually a sign of strength, not weakness.

I've also been thinking a lot about the idea of "comparison is the thief of joy" and how it relates to social media. When I'm scrolling through my feeds,
